text: what's up everyone this video is going
to be a quick uh demo and intro to site
rag showing you how to use the different
features and then also get it set up and
running locally in your machine so site
rag is a Chrome extension which allows
you to ask questions and get answers uh
from a given web page or an entire
website uh you can use context stuff
mode which will just take the current
page stuff the entire contents into the
lm's context uh and then give you an
answer or retrieval mode which allows
you to Index this page or site uh
persist those uh chunk documents into a
vector store and then perform rag on
them to get your answers uh we'll use
context stuff and we'll we're going to
ask it a question about fir craws
extract feature so I'm on their Doc Page
right here I can switch to sonit 35 and
I can say uh summarize summarize how the

just so I can show you exactly what is
going on while this um request runs so
I'll hit send
we can see it's going to call the scrape
endpoint which going to be scraping the
current page once it gets the results
it's going to call the uh endpoint for
whatever model I've selected and a
stream back and answer uh based on my
question so you can see it says the ex
extract works by providing a URL
entering a prompt description and then
viroc CW will do XYZ so this is how the
cont or the context sing mode works uh
we can see it's scraped it then also
will persist this these page contents
into my browser's local database uh
index DB and that way if I ever come
back to it we can see I've started a new
chat I can ask it another question like
what do I need to pass the prompt for

database um so it doesn't need to scrape

we can start a new chat and I can show

retrieval mode I'll first need to index
the page or if I wanted to index the
entire site I could do that um that's
going to index all the different pages
on this site uh or there's an option to
only index child pages but for this I
just want to care about this site so
I'll click index page um there's also an
option to delete existing documents
which match the uh page URL I'm on so I

contents um generate these documents in
beddings and then it's going to upload
them to uh superbase which is the
database uh once it's done we can see
success deleted documents for URLs and
then I can ask it a question uh so what
this did is it just scraped this page it
chunked them the chunking is
configurable in the settings tab where I
can also set my API keys my Vector store
configuration uh this can run olama um I
can set the chunk size and chunk overlap
overlap the max context documents to
include in the context when ask for a
question or when asking a question and
also I can update my system
prompt if I go back I can ask a question
like how does how does extract work I
hit send we can see it's going to
generate an embedding for my query it's
then going to match documents based on
my um embedded query and then uh get the

can see it gave me an answer similar to
what the uh original one did for context
stuffing but what this did is it didn't
just include the entire page context but
it did semantic search on my documents
in my Vector store and only included
those in the uh context so I've started
a fresh chat and now I can select
multi-query modes what this going to do
is it's going to take my initial query
from there it's going to generate a
number of additional queries which are
similar to my initial one it's going to
then embed all of those and perform
semantic search on all of those
additional queries then using the
documents from those additional semantic
search queries it's going to uh remove
duplicates and include them in my
context and this can allow me to get uh
a much uh greater number of highquality
documents to use inside my context
window so I can ask at a question like
how can I parse all the URLs in the
website for extract we can see the
answer is right here and when I send
this it's going to first call the
messages endpoint for my model and
generate a number of additional queries
then it's going to generate embeddings
for all of those queries and match
documents for each of those when this is
done it's going to remove the duplicates
uh include all of those uh return
documents in the final context and then
give me an answer so we can see it gave
us the correct answer here
so that is how you use uh site rag now
